comment: The course schedule, syllabus, and overall expectations are clear. I took a 7 Week Online class so the workload was heavier. As long as you read over, not even study the texts, you will get an 90-100% on the quizzes and the text based portions of the Exams. Innovate more than summarize for discussions, and don't hesitate to send emails.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Weekly discussion posts and worksheets, along with 2 projects. Instructions were unclear at times, and hw was a lot of work-- taking hrs per week. Class was so much fun and I loved class discussions however. Genuinely enjoyed coming to class. She's kind, funny, and caring, don't hesitate to communicate with her (preferably in person, NOT email)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: She is very involved with the class and personally wants to help you do as best as you can on the research proposal and paper. Not the quickest to email responses, especially for a 1 day a week hybrid course, but she gives clear expectations, guidelines, and material for your assignments. I never liked English but she made class enjoyable.

Idk if I just got lucky, or if she improved a ton this semester, but I seen all bad reviews that weren't true for my class. I had a hybrid class and she was very friendly & energetic in person. It was a research class & we could pick what to research. Assignments were mini projects to help with your final paper. I personally enjoyed her class.

Impossible to reach via email, D2L, you name it. She does not get back to you and if she does it'll be extremely last minute and you're stuck. Take any other professor especially if it's an online class. English is a very strong suit for me and I ended the class with the worst grade I've ever had because she doesn't teach anything or grade properly
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Awful. Do not take this professor. I took prof F for an online 6 week class and it was the worst. She was not accessible more than literally once the whole course period, and was extremely dismissive when I was finally able to contact her. Not lenient with work and will not help you out even when you weren't the one at fault. Take someone else.

mandatory attendance, exams lockdown no webcam but questions are practically impossible to find online, meaning you MUST study. 1 discussion + 1 worksheet weekly over an entire module, which takes a good bit of time, also a midterm and final. great person but hard to balance this class when you have to study for other classes.
midterms and Final are weighted high but very easy eacher
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: I had her in the fall semester and I remember that she was very outgoing and engaging. She cares a lot about her students and is happy to give feedback. Her lectures can get a bit political at times, but nothing too bad. I wasn't a fan of the final group project we had to do, but she made it a lot easier by taking assignments late.
She's a really kind and understanding teacher. Her classes were always engaging and fun. She put in grades a little late, but recognized the she did and was very lenient with due dates.

Dr. Ferguson is a great professor. She's very outgoing, engaging, and loves to learn new things. Her Paper's in ENGL 1101 are like every other paper you've written in HS (not too hard). She's an easy grader because a lot of her week assignments are very easy, and she helps you plan out paper's before you write them. Do take her, it's an easy class!

She is nice an easy to talk to in-person but is impossible to get to through emails. Then responds in the most vague manner, leaving you even more confused. She is very last-minute with things, and doesn't explain the assignments properly. She had a lot of personal problems this sem, but I wish she'd help us out some more.
slayed the house boots down houston im deceased

Grades for attendance but super understanding about coming in late, pretty easy grader, most of the readings were great reads, class discussions were nice, she does give pop quizzes so do the readings, final is a creative project

Top tier professor, definitely recommend for any English class. She incorporates real-life situations into her discussion and it makes the class enjoyable. A lot of reading for American Lit, but understandable since it is a lit class. Make sure to attend class for in class assignments!!! Overall, super chill!

EASY A!!! Took her 50% "hybrid class" where we had in person class once a week and only did one easy online assignment a week(30 minutes). We had 3 papers, she gave me an A on all of them (easy grader). ATTENDENCE IS 20% OF UR GRADE!!!!!!!! NO FINALLLLLLL!!!!

She is very understanding and loves to listen about your thoughts on topics. There are weekly assignments but she always explains them in class. There are 3 major papers but all have a good amount of time to complete them. Attendance is a part of your grade so make sure to show up.

She's a very understanding and engaging teacher. There's a lot of reading and discussion posts, but that's to be expected for an English course. All the tests are online and there's a final creative project that you should look out for at the end of the year.
a very underrated professor. she let me turn in a project 13 days late. thats all i gotta say

She honestly wasn't too bad. 3 papers and gave a 2 day extension for each paper. The papers increase in page length as the semester goes on but she is more than willing to help you with any part of the writing stage. She does have weekly assignments that sometimes can be heavy but she explains them in class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Ferguson is an exceptional human being. The work can seem a bit intimidating but do the readings and read the powerpoints (or listen) and you'll do just fine. An easy A for sure. She can be a bit slow at grading but she's very kind and is 100% accessible outside of class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Ferguson was honestly one of the best professors I've had so far in college. She is very helpful with feedback and will respond quickly if you have questions outside of the classroom. Very understanding and genuinely wants to help you. Someone I could sit down and have a coffee with after class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Worst teacher ever. Gives easily weekly assignments and teaches you nothing. When it comes down to the grades that matter she is unclear and grades very harshly. I believed I was strong in English before this class. I recieved a C and have always gotten A's in english. Even after reaching out for help she still failed me on major papers.
Dr. Ferguson is amazing. She left really great feedback on my papers, and is really clear on her expectations for each one. Homework was due once a week but relatively easy work. Really great class.

She was hilarious and a good teacher. My class was a hybrid so we had a weekly assignment, which count for most of your grade so DO THEM! There were about 3 papers that are relatively easy, just listen when she goes over them. Class is pointless but attendance is a grade so don't miss it. We just met once a week so nothing terrible.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: A real gem, she was clear and precise and not too political. She gave lectures off the readings that really made you understand what the heck you just read. Keep up with the readings, keep up with the readings, KEEP UP WITH THE READINGS, and you should do fine. Super nice and can answer any question you have, on anything in class.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The readings are a must. Quizzes are over the concepts, not what it's about. Midterm was fairly easy, if you make a quizlet over everything. One paper & its due towards end of semester. Extremely caring, very passionate, will make you work, great lectures, & takes student feedback into account for everything. Great professor, quizzes can suck tho.

This professor is pretty condescending and drops a couple of curse words every class. Whenever I asked a question in class i was left feeling more confused than when i asked the question. She is also a tough grader for essays so beware. I ended up withdrawing from this class after 3 weeks.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: There are 3 papers and a final project. The whole class consists of you focusing on an object that interests you like point shoes, your mother's iron skillet, stuff like that. She makes the class interesting. She gives assignments every week so do them. She gives great feedback on your check-in points and your paper. She gives you the textbook.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Ferguson is great. I had her for 1101 and she is so nice. I honestly don't understand why some people on here think she's bad. I've always been an A and B student and I did completely ok. Those who give bad rating are probably used to professors not giving them any work. Only 4 essays and a final project which is easy. She's one of the best!
not understand, not accommodating, not nice at all. would not recommend taking her at all. makes this class way too hard & workload is insane. do yourself a favor & find another professor
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Ferguson has been one of the best professors I have had at Kennesaw so far. She cares deeply about her students and material and teaches it with a passion. I have taken her once again for ENGL 2110 after a fantastic experience in 1102. You'll work hard, but as long as you simply do the readings, attend class and do the HW you'll be good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I loved her. She was very clear about her expectations in each paper. She even decreased the page numbers for our paper and gave us an extension. I had her class once a week so she expected everyone to be there. We had an assignment every week plus our 3 papers and the final project/research paper. In every assignment she gave very good feedback.

Very militant; a 4 page single spaced annotated bibliography for a ten page double spaced paper. Seems pretty nice. Instructions are not clear. Work load is that of someone who has no life outside of this class. Would not recommend, would not take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--SO MANY PAPERS
